questions.text: What will be the treatment of an incidentally detected finding shown in the image?
What could be the possible diagnosis of a 35-year-old male patient with a history of hypertension and bilateral palpable flank lumps, and whose abdominal ultrasound is shown below?
questions.correct_answer: B. Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease

questions.text: What is not true regarding renal stones?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common type of stone is struvite

options.label: B
options.text: Small stones can be managed conservatively with pharmacotherapy

options.label: C
options.text: Soft stones can be removed by ESWL

options.label: D
options.text: Envelope shaped crystals are seen in calcium oxalate dihydrate stones

questions.correct_answer: A. Most common type of stone is struvite
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Most common type of stone is struvite

questions.text: A patient with ureteric colic is being investigated. What is the investigation of choice for diagnosis?

A 34-year-old female patient presents with lower abdominal pain, frequent urination, and signs of dehydration. Physical examination reveals abdominal tenderness, and urine analysis indicates sterile pyuria. An image is provided. What is the most likely condition?

A 56-year-old male has been recently diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma. The imaging studies reveal that the tumor is 3 cm in size. Based on this information, what would be the most appropriate initial treatment approach for this patient's condition?

A 10-year-old boy presented to the surgery OPD. On examination, his left scrotal sac is empty and under-developed. On clinical examination the left testis was found in the superficial inguinal pouch. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An 8-year-old boy presents with right-sided acute scrotum. Examination reveals tenderness which worsens on lifting the testis. Which of these is the likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old Type 2 diabetic patient presents with fever and hypotension to the casualty. He gives a history of a boil in the perianal area which developed 2 weeks ago. On examination, the perianal area is as shown in the picture below. Identify the incorrect statement about this condition:

options.label: A
options.text: It is caused by multiple organisms

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical treatment is required in most cases

questions.text: Identify the incorrect statement about carcinoma penis:

options.label: A
options.text: Circumcision is protective of Ca penis only if done soon after birth

options.label: B
options.text: Enlarged inguinal lymph nodes are due to infection and not metastasis in many cases

options.label: C
options.text: It is usually a squamous cell carcinoma

options.label: D
options.text: It usually arises from the shaft of the penis

questions.correct_answer: D. It usually arises from the shaft of the penis
questions.explanation: Ans. D) It usually arises from the shaft of the penis

questions.text: A patient with a history of chest trauma with breathlessness on examination is found to have systolic BP of 90 mmHg, spO2 of 85%, GCS 8/15, absent breath sounds. What is the next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Secure airway, needle thoracotomy, and IV fluids

options.label: B
options.text: Blood transfusion and send for CT

options.label: C
options.text: Take history, administer IV Dextrose, and send for eFAST

options.label: D
options.text: CT scan of the head and airway securing

questions.correct_answer: A. Secure airway, needle thoracotomy, and IV fluids
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Secure airway, needle thoracotomy, and IV fluids

questions.text: Following trauma, which of the following injury takes the least time leading to death?

A 25 years old male patient with alleged history of road traffic accident sustained injury over chest and abdomen. At the time of presentation, systolic BP was 70 mm Hg and pulse rate was 110/minute. Which of the following is the next step?
Following head trauma, the patient opens eyes to pain, localizes pain on the right trapezium, withdraws on the left side, and speaks incoherent words. His GCS is:

A 25-year-old male was brought to the emergency department after being struck on his head by the house door and temporarily fainted. On examination, his sensorium was intact. NCCT head was performed and was a normal study. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What should be the next step in a patient who presented in the emergency with respiratory distress, dilated neck veins, hypotension and hyper-resonance on percussion?

options.label: A
options.text: Wide bore needle insertion in 5th intercostal space

questions.correct_answer: A. Wide bore needle insertion in 5th intercostal space
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Wide bore needle insertion in 5th intercostal space

questions.text: A patient of RTA was brought to the hospital with left flank bruise associated with hematuria. Patient was hemodynamically stable. Which of the following investigation should be done for hematuria?
Identify the mismatch component of TRIAGE color coding:

A man is brought to the emergency after he fell into a man hole and injured his perineum. He feels the urge to micturate but is unable to pass urine and there is blood at the tip of the meatus with extensive swelling of the perineal region and penis and scrotum. What is the location of the injury?
Which of these is not considered as a locally advanced breast cancer?

A 50-year-old female patient presents with a 4x3 cm mass in right breast, that is not fixed to the skin or chest wall. A mobile lymph node is palpable in the right axilla. Which of the following investigations would you perform in this patient? Bilateral mammogram Biopsy of the breast mass USG guided biopsy of the lymph node Ductoscopy
questions.correct_answer: B. I, II, III are correct
questions.explanation: Ans. B) I, II, III are correct

questions.text: Which of these is not a contra-indication for BCT?
The Recurrent laryngeal nerve is at greatest risk of injury during thyroidectomy at what site?
Identify the incorrect statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Follicular Ca can be diagnosed on capsular or vascular invasion only

options.label: B
options.text: Follicular Ca occurs in the setting of MNG

options.label: C
options.text: Follicular Ca is the most common thyroid malignancy

options.label: D
options.text: Open biopsy may be required in anaplastic Ca

questions.correct_answer: C. Follicular Ca is the most common thyroid malignancy
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Follicular Ca is the most common thyroid malignancy

questions.text: All of the following are the components of MEN-3 except:
After total thyroidectomy under GA, the anesthetist tried to extubate the patient but he was unable to extubate. What is the most probable reason?
questions.correct_answer: B. Bilateral recurrent laryngeal nerve damage
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Bilateral recurrent laryngeal nerve damage

questions.text: A 65-year-old male presents with neck swelling that moves up on deglutition. You perform a test as shown in the image. What is the diagnosis?

Identify the incorrect statement about thyroidectomy technique:

options.label: A
options.text: First structure to be ligated is middle thyroid vein

options.label: B
options.text: Accidentally removed parathyroids may be re-implanted in sternomastoid muscle

options.label: C
options.text: Superior thyroid artery is ligated individually near the upper pole

options.label: D
options.text: Inferior thyroid artery is ligated individually away from lower pole

questions.correct_answer: D. Inferior thyroid artery is ligated individually away from lower pole
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Inferior thyroid artery is ligated individually away from lower pole

questions.text: Identify the Pathology:
In a degloving injury, structures that get stripped include:
A child is born with a neck swelling as shown. The swelling shows brilliant transillumination. This occurs due to defect in development of?
50 year old presents with swelling as shown. All of these are true regarding the swelling except?

options.label: D
options.text: Swelling usually arises from the deep lobe of the gland

questions.explanation: Ans. D) Swelling usually arises from the deep lobe of the gland

questions.text: In Modified Radical Neck Dissection (MRND), which of the following structures is not preserved?

options.label: B
options.text: Most common site is the calf

options.label: D
options.text: Claudication distance varies on a daily basis

questions.correct_answer: B. Most common site is the calf
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Most common site is the calf

questions.text: A chronic smoker gets cramping pain in his calves after walking about 500 m. Pain gets relieved with a few minutes of rest. What is the likely pathology?
Identify the incorrect statement about peripheral vascular disease:

options.label: A
options.text: On Doppler, “monophasic flow” implies normal flow in arteries

options.label: C
options.text: 0.1 decrease in ABPI leads 10% increase in mortality

options.label: D
options.text: Toe pressure is more reliable of ischemia in patients with diabetes

questions.correct_answer: A. On Doppler, “monophasic flow” implies normal flow in arteries
questions.explanation: Ans. A) On Doppler, “monophasic flow” implies normal flow in arteries

questions.text: A 55-year-old male patient with hypertension presents to the hospital with severe abdominal pain and is detected with an abdominal aortic aneurysm. What is the appropriate management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: USG monitoring till the size of the aneurysm reaches 70 mm

options.label: C
options.text: Elective surgery after the size reaches 55 mm

questions.text: You are an intern and are going to perform ABG sample collection in a patient. What test will you perform prior to procedure?
All of the following are true about venous ulcer except:

options.label: A
options.text: Seen most commonly in the lower part of the leg, in the area around the medial malleolus

options.label: C
options.text: Active venous ulcer is classified as CEAP C6

options.label: D
options.text: Bisgaard regimen is followed in its treatment

questions.correct_answer: B. Ulcer is painful and deep
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Ulcer is painful and deep
